H0.text: ln the Bible Old Testament, who was the first High Priest of the Hebrews. Moses

H1.text: ln the Bible Old Testament, who was the first High Priest of the Hebrews. Melchizedek

H2.text: ln the Bible Old Testament, who was the first High Priest of the Hebrews. Abraham

H3.text: ln the Bible Old Testament, who was the first High Priest of the Hebrews. AARON

A4.text: The first high priest was Aaron himself, the ancestor of all priests.

A5.text: In legends the first man that assumed the title of high priest of God is Enoch, who was succeeded by Methuselah, Lamech, Noah, Shem, Melchizedek, Abraham, Isaac and Levi.

A6.text: Like all priests, he was required to be descended from Aaron, the first priest in the Torah.

A7.text: Aaron was appointed to this role by Yahweh according to Exodus 28:1–2 and 29:4–5.
